column1: Aranrúth was the sword of the Elves King Thingol of Doriath in the First Age.  Thingol apparently prized his weapon; when Beleg asked Thingol for a sword of worth for his quest to seek Túrin
column2: the King said he could have his choice of any except his own.
column3: p. 96  After his death the sword was passed on to his descendants and Elwing rescued it from the Second Kinslaying.

column2: the first King of Númenor received it from his mother
column3: and from there on it became an heirloom of the Kings of Númenor. It was lost in the Downfall of Númenor.

column1: Aranrúth means "Kings Ire" in Sindarin (from aran "king" and rûth "anger").
